page.title: 11Religion In Blacon
page.content: There is only one religion represented in Blacon ie Christianity. However there are four different versions each having a church.{The {Church of England}has its church on Norris Road and is called "Holy Trinity".On Clifton Road the{Mormon {church is called the}"Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints".The Kingdon Hall of the{Jehovah's {Witnesses}is on Melbourne Road.The Roman Catholic church on Blacon Avenue is called "Saint Theresa's". Both the Mormon church and the Jehovah's Witnesses have no{clergy, but the Holy Trinity church and Saint Theresa's church do have clergy. The Roman Catholic church has a Father Brizzel and a Father J.Kennedy.All four churches have services on Sundays as well as on weekdays.Similarly all provide social events for members.
